name: Angular Resolution
explanation: Angular resolution is smallest angle telescope can distinguish. Limited by diffraction: θ = 1.22λ/D where λ is wavelength, D is aperture diameter. Larger telescopes have better resolution. Used to determine telescope capabilities and understand why we need large telescopes or interferometry for detailed observations.

examples.problem: Hubble Space Telescope has 2.4m aperture. What is angular resolution at visible light (550 nm)?
Why do we need very large telescopes?
examples.solution: Resolution improves with diameter - need large D to see fine details
steps: To see smaller details, need larger aperture
Event Horizon Telescope: Earth-sized aperture via interferometry
Imaged black hole shadow (requires microarcsecond resolution)
